poem:
Swift Justice

Far-right eyes flared under halogen moons,
voices like burglars climbing through a window of history.
Then, sirens—a stiff wind pushing them back
into the corners of disbelief.
The night stretched its spine,
and the constellations sighed in unison,
as justice, swift as dawn,
climbed over rooftops,
turning shadows into silent witnesses.
